{"step_by_step_thinking": "IPC stands for Indian Penal Code. The Indian Penal Code (IPC) is the official criminal code of India. It is a comprehensive code intended to cover all substantive aspects of criminal law. The code was drafted in 1860 and is still in force in India. Section 312 of the IPC deals with causing miscarriage. If a person voluntarily causes a woman with child to miscarry, he shall be punished. If the woman is quick with child, the punishment can be more severe. Therefore, the IPC section dealing with illegal abortion with woman consent is 312.", "answer_choice": "B"}
